title: Job Vacancies at Cravecity Mega Limited
content:
Cravecity Mega Limited is a Quick service restaurant. We offer excellent services with the best bites that satisfies every customers cravings. We encourage a favourable work environment by promoting a greatwork culture.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Operation Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Operations Manager in a QSR will beresponsible for overseeing daily restaurant operations across multiple outlets to ensure efficiency, profitability, and consistent delivery of high-quality food and customer service.
	This role involves supervising outlet managers, ensuring compliance with operational standards, managing budgets, optimizing resources, and driving performance to achieve business goals.
	The Operations Manager serves as a bridge between senior management and outlet teams, ensuring smooth execution of company policies and strategies.


Key Responsibilities
Operations Management:


	Oversee daily operations of all QSR outlets, ensuring adherence to company standards in food quality, speed of service, cleanliness, and safety.
	Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to maintain consistency across all locations.
	Monitor and analyze operational performance (sales, customer feedback, wastage, labor costs) and take corrective actions where necessary.


People Management:


	Lead, coach, and mentor outlet managers and their teams to drive operational excellence.
	Ensure proper staffing levels, training, and shift scheduling across outlets.
	Promote a culture of accountability, teamwork, and customer-first service.
	Handle escalated employee or customer issues professionally.


Financial & Business Performance:


	Monitor sales, cost of goods sold (COGS), labor costs, and overheads to maintain profitability.
	Assist in setting and achieving sales targets, budgets, and KPIs for each outlet.
	Control inventory levels and minimize waste through effective stock management and reconciliation.
	Provide weekly and monthly operational performance reports to senior management.


Compliance & Quality Control:


	Ensure all outlets comply with food safety, hygiene, and health regulations.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits of outlets for quality assurance.
	Enforce brand consistency in service, menu presentation, and customer experience.


Strategic & Process Improvement:


	Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
	Implement new technologies, systems, or processes to enhance productivity.
	Support new store openings, including recruitment, training, and setup.
	Collaborate with other departments (HR, Finance, Procurement, Marketing) to support business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related field.
	5–7 years of experience in restaurant or QSR operations, with at least 3 years in a managerial role.
	Proficiency in MS Office and familiarity with POS and inventory management systems.


Key Skills & Competencies


	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Good financial acumen and ability to interpret P&L reports.
	Knowledge of QSR industry trends, food safety, and hygiene regulations.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work under pressure.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@cravecityng.com using "Procurement QSR" as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.

 


2.) Senior Procurement Officer

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To source, negotiate, and purchase quality raw materials, packaging, beverages, equipment, and services at the best value, ensuring timely supply to meet QSR operational demands while maintaining cost efficiency and supplier compliance.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and evaluate suppliers to ensure quality, cost-effectiveness, and reliability.
	Negotiate pricing, payment terms, and supply agreements.
	Raise purchase orders (POs) and ensure timely approvals.
	Monitor inventory levels and liaise with the Stock Reconciliation Officer to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Maintain supplier database and performance records.
	Ensure procurement aligns with approved budgets and operational needs.
	Track deliveries, resolve shortages, and handle supplier-related issues.
	Ensure all purchases comply with company policies and quality standards.
	Support periodic supplier audits and product quality checks.
	Prepare and submit procurement reports to management.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum 2–5years of  experience in procurement, preferably in QSR or FMCG.
	Strong negotiation and supplier management skills.
	Knowledge of food safety and quality standards.
	Proficiency in MS Office and inventory management tools.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and cost-consciousness


Application Closing Date:30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@cravecityng.com using "Procurement QSR" as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07017425977.

 

 

3.) Outlet Manager

Job Locations: Ikoyi, Abulegba, Gbagada, Akowonjo, Ikotun Egbe, Magboro, Festac, Berger - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Outlet Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the restaurant, ensuring excellent customer service, managing staff performance, maintaining food quality and hygiene standards, and achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate all daily restaurant operations
	Ensure high standards of food quality, cleanliness, and customer service
	Manage and motivate staff to perform efficiently and professionally
	Handle customer complaints and feedback professionally
	Monitor stock levels and coordinate with suppliers for timely replenishment
	Maintain accurate records of sales, expenses, and inventory
	Ensure compliance with company policies, health and safety regulations
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports for management review
	Train new staff and conduct regular performance reviews


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc in relevant field
	Proven experience in a similar role (preferably in QSR or hospitality industry)
	Good leadership and people management skills
	Strong communication and problem-solving abilities
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
	Basic knowledge of stock and cash management


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@cravecityng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquires, WhatsApp only: 07074711804, 07017425977.

Senior Engineer Job at Egbin Power Plc.




        
    

        
        Egbin Power Plc. Lagos is one of the biggest additions to the electricity industry in Nigeria. Often seen as the biggest single generating power station in Sub-Saharan Africa, it was built to meet the every rising demand for electricity in Lagos and its environs.

Following the nation’s privatization exercise, Sahara, through its power division, Sahara Power Group and sundry affiliations, acquired the 1320 MW installed capacity Egbin Power Plant. We are working towards deploying a minimum of 5,000 MW of electricity generation over the next five years.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Engineer
     

            
    



Job Identification: 392
Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Senior Engineer MechanicalMaintenance supervises the maintenance of all turbine, boiler and auxiliary equipment.


Key Duties & Responsibilities


	Supervise daily routine, preventive, and breakdown maintenance of mechanical equipment (boiler, turbine, and auxiliary equipment).
	Conduct overhaul /major/minor inspections of the mechanical equipment.
	Plan and monitor the overhaul schedule to achieve high plant reliability.
	Preparation and effective utilisation of the maintenance budget and control.
	Oversee spare parts planning, purchase and inspection activities.
	Ensure day-to-day adherence to the highest industry safety standards in the boiler unit.
	Troubleshooting of the equipment malfunctions and finalising corrective actions.


Education & Work Experience


	Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in Mechanical or Production Engineering.
	Minimum of Five (5) years of relevant work experience.
	Postgraduate/relevant professional qualification is an added advantage.


Skills and Competencies:


	Experience and working exposure in the maintenance of boilers, generators, and auxiliaries. 
	In-depth understanding of boiler operations. 
	Knowledge of pressure systems.
	Knowledge of rotary equipment.
	Sound technical troubleshooting skills.
	Ability to provide technical expertise to the team. 
	Adequate knowledge and use of boiler equipment 
	Appreciable knowledge of safety requirements.
	Knowledge of standard operating procedures concerning the maintenance of the boiler, generator, and auxiliaries. 
	Sound knowledge of power generation processes.
	Knowledge of modern maintenance management practices.  
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suites.

  "title": "Customer Fulfilment Specialist",
  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Customer Fulfilment Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type: Hybrid

About The Role


	The Customer Fulfillment Specialist will serve as the interface between the company and customers.
	The person will ensure that customers&rsquo; orders are fulfilled in a timely and satisfactory manner, so customers return and refer the business to other potential customers.
	Department Operations Employment Type Permanent - Full Time Location Nigeria Workplace type Hybrid


What You Would Be Expected To Do


	Manage a cluster of retail shops or partners to ensure timely fulfilment of all customer orders.
	Prepare proforma invoices, packing lists, and other required sales/export documentation.
	Handle investigations and reconciliations of customer complaints and queries (e.g., short delivery, damaged goods, delays, blocked orders, wrong invoicing/pricing) promptly and accurately.
	Communicate with customers to ensure satisfaction after service delivery.
	Participate in the development and implementation of customer service and fulfilment policies and procedures.
	Direct the daily operations of the fulfilment service team to ensure efficiency and compliance with standards.
	Plan and prioritize work tasks to guarantee proper departmental functions.
	Track and review customer complaints and resolutions, ensuring timely closure.
	Handle complex and escalated fulfilment/customer service issues.
	Define, communicate, and monitor customer/fulfilment service standards.
	Develop and track customer/fulfilment satisfaction goals, while coordinating team efforts to achieve them.
	Report on key fulfilment metrics such as order processing time, on-time departure rate, and fulfilment accuracy.
	Maintain accurate customer databases in line with approved financial risk levels.
	Work with the Sales team to monitor and classify trade returns by reason codes and implement measures to minimize recurrence.
	Focus on key customer service drivers: proactive communication, timely order processing, efficient order management, and excellent service delivery.
	Work with the Logistics Coordinator to ensure on-time delivery of customer and retail outlet orders.


Requirements
You Might Be a Strong Candidate If You:


	Have a minimum of HND / BSc in Supply Chain / Purchasing and Supplies /Business Management or related field.
	Have 2 years of cogent experience preferably FMCG in the supply chain line .
	Possess strong Excel/analytical skills (macros, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, charts) to provide actionable data insights.
	Are good in solving problems with an open mind to go the extra mile.
	Have good Internal Stakeholder Management.
	Have the ability to accept changes and come up with agile solutions
	Possess solid supply chain management (SCM) knowledge.
	Are an effective time manager and work under little or no supervision.
	Have soft skills such as turning complaints into opportunities, handling difficult customers, and managing customers&rsquo; expectations.
	Knowledge and hands on experience in warehousing and distribution.
	Have the ability to work with distributors, sales teams, and sales agents to ensure smooth distribution operations.
	Have knowledge and working experience with a robust ERP / WMS (knowledge of SAP materials management module is an added advantage).

Customer Fulfilment Specialist Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Fulfilment Specialist
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Department: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Workplace type: Hybrid

About The Role


	The Customer Fulfillment Specialist will serve as the interface between the company and customers.
	The person will ensure that customers’ orders are fulfilled in a timely and satisfactory manner, so customers return and refer the business to other potential customers.
	Department Operations Employment Type Permanent - Full Time Location Nigeria Workplace type Hybrid


What You Would Be Expected To Do


	Manage a cluster of retail shops or partners to ensure timely fulfilment of all customer orders.
	Prepare proforma invoices, packing lists, and other required sales/export documentation.
	Handle investigations and reconciliations of customer complaints and queries (e.g., short delivery, damaged goods, delays, blocked orders, wrong invoicing/pricing) promptly and accurately.
	Communicate with customers to ensure satisfaction after service delivery.
	Participate in the development and implementation of customer service and fulfilment policies and procedures.
	Direct the daily operations of the fulfilment service team to ensure efficiency and compliance with standards.
	Plan and prioritize work tasks to guarantee proper departmental functions.
	Track and review customer complaints and resolutions, ensuring timely closure.
	Handle complex and escalated fulfilment/customer service issues.
	Define, communicate, and monitor customer/fulfilment service standards.
	Develop and track customer/fulfilment satisfaction goals, while coordinating team efforts to achieve them.
	Report on key fulfilment metrics such as order processing time, on-time departure rate, and fulfilment accuracy.
	Maintain accurate customer databases in line with approved financial risk levels.
	Work with the Sales team to monitor and classify trade returns by reason codes and implement measures to minimize recurrence.
	Focus on key customer service drivers: proactive communication, timely order processing, efficient order management, and excellent service delivery.
	Work with the Logistics Coordinator to ensure on-time delivery of customer and retail outlet orders.


Requirements
You Might Be a Strong Candidate If You:


	Have a minimum of HND / BSc in Supply Chain / Purchasing and Supplies /Business Management or related field.
	Have 2 years of cogent experience preferably FMCG in the supply chain line .
	Possess strong Excel/analytical skills (macros, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, charts) to provide actionable data insights.
	Are good in solving problems with an open mind to go the extra mile.
	Have good Internal Stakeholder Management.
	Have the ability to accept changes and come up with agile solutions
	Possess solid supply chain management (SCM) knowledge.
	Are an effective time manager and work under little or no supervision.
	Have soft skills such as turning complaints into opportunities, handling difficult customers, and managing customers’ expectations.
	Knowledge and hands on experience in warehousing and distribution.
	Have the ability to work with distributors, sales teams, and sales agents to ensure smooth distribution operations.
	Have knowledge and working experience with a robust ERP / WMS (knowledge of SAP materials management module is an added advantage).
